info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 1:16AM EST until December 27 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Transylvania and Henderson Counties. .Light to moderate rain has persisted across the upper French Broad River Valley since Monday morning. The watershed has gradually received 2 to 4 inches of rainfall, with isolated areas along the Tanasee and Pisgah Ridges approaching 5 inches. This has saturated upper soils and is causing excessive runoff into the headwaters of the French Broad River, resulting in significant rises downstream from Brevard to Blantyre to Etowah. Based on rainfall already received, the French Broad River is expected to approach and possibly exceed bankfull, causing nuisance flooding of adjacent, low-lying areas later this morning. However, moderate to heavy rainfall may develop later this morning, which would cause more significant rises to occur. This may result in deeper flooding of low-lying areas and possible impacts to common flood-prone roadways. Monitor the latest river observations and forecasts for updates. A River Flood Warning may be required if the French Broad River is expected to exceed 16.5-17.0 feet. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...French Broad River at Blantyre. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Action Stage. Most farm fields are flooding between the French Broad River and Brevard Rd. and between the French Broad River and Pleasant Grove Rd. At 16.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Farmland flooding continues on both sides of the French Broad River. Floodwaters begin to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd and Crab Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.7 feet and rising steadily. - Forecast...The river is expected to approach the Minor Flood Stage of 16.0 feet late this morning or during the afternoon. Additional rounds of heavy rainfall may force the river to exceed Minor Flood Stage and approach 17.0 feet this afternoon or evening. If this heavy rainfall/runoff occurs, a River Flood Warning may be required. - Action/Advisory Stage is 15.0 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you are in the Advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the Advisory being upgraded to a Warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement issuance will occur on or before Wednesday morning at 700 AM EST.
